place_description: Specialty coffee shop, craft beer, wine cocktail bar as well as local pastries, free live music

reviews_data.review_text: Such a yummy coffee, I got a caramel latte and my husband got a black walnut latte that he said was for sure top 3 coffees he has had!
This place is so cozy. I love how they decorate it. The coffee is great and all my friends were happy with their also
Coffee is a bit expensive but deff worth the price. Not to mention, the atmosphere is phenomenal. Great place to read or work on your laptop. Totally recommend!
If you run out of straws, serve some kind of stirring utensil. Also... who serves doughnuts and then doesn't heat them up? Cold, hours-old pastry gone stale for $4. Next!
Hobbyist has some of the best coffee in town with a great ambiance. It feels amazing every time I go there.

This cafe and bar's spacious layout with all the wood and plants really caught my eye - honestly, it left more of an impression than the drinks.

The menu looked so good that I was tempted to go for a cocktail, but we had a packed day ahead. Since my friend and I are lightweights, we stuck with a matcha latte and a chai latte instead.

The matcha was subtle but had a bit more flavor than most places. They've got all sorts of seating options - big tables, small ones - so it seems like a chill spot to hang out when it's not busy.

Kinda bummed we couldn't try the cocktails, but it was still a nice break. Might have to come back when we've got more time to kill!
The Hobbyist has a very cool atmosphere, friendly staff and great coffee. I highly recommend you check them out.
Woke up to a foggy brained Sunday morning, but nothing that a diesel fuel cold brew couldn't fix. Love the vibe here and being able to sit out on the porch on a sunny morning.
Amazing service great recommendations. Honesty best lazy back great customer service place Iv been to. I will be back
Great coffee.  Great staff.  Great prices.  It's everything you'd want from a coffee shop.
Not much in this store

In terms of flavor, this is absolutely my favorite coffee shop in Charlotte. They often have unique and delicious latte recipes. However, don't come here if you're in a rush. These wait is a little longer than average, but the quality of the product completely explains why. Great atmosphere as well!
Nathan is the best, I don't normally make espresso martinis but Nathan makes the best. Great vibes here :)
Outdoor seating and very comfortable seating indoors. Great place to work or socialize . Dog friendly outdoor seating . Get there early for better selection of sweets .

Service 10/10
Coffee 6/10

I wish I lived closer so that I could visit more often. I absolutely love this place, their staff, their ownership, and their products. Great selection of quality beers, wines, spirits, and fantastic coffee drinks. Stopping by is a must when I'm in the area!
This is a very chill vibe as it combines a wine bar, bottle shop and cafe. A great place to relax, work, or have a date. Staff are extremely knowledgeable and friendly
My absolute favorite coffee spot to take people. Service is always great, drinks are never wrong and the place is gorgeous. Keep it up guys!
Chill atmosphere & friendly staff. Didn't draw much of a crowd.
I love getting coffee and working from here

Come here everyday to work and have always loved the environment. Coffee is amazing. People are amazing.
Shout out to Alana and Maddie!
My go to coffee spot and 2nd home!
One of my favorite places in Charlotte. Excellent coffee, lots or local beers, and a good selection of wine.

I've been coming here more recently, and have really enjoyed it. It's a great place to get some work done, and the drink choices are yummy. The baristas are great, but Jay has been particularly helpful! I see her frequently when I come in, and she makes me feel like a regular now. Great place!
This place is awesome! The atmosphere is fun and warm. The staff were super nice. What was supposed to be a quick coffee stop turned into so much more!
The place looks great and has a good selection of wines and beer. The baristas aren't very friendly though. They seemed to want you to know their menu in advance.

Stopped by on my way to an appointment up the street and ordered two simple lattes, one vanilla and one caramel. There seemed to be two people ahead of me but it took the baristas 12 minutes to make my drinks. There were two people working and they kept talking in between each drink and continued without a care in the world.
Instead of finishing the drinks they kept attending people at the register. Finally, and very unfortunately, I had to ask if my drinks were ready and the barista replied with some attitude.
Now, if you have time, and want to sit down to work, I think this place would be great for you.
The vibe is cool but I've definitely received timely(er) service in other independent coffee shops.
Love studying here but this is the second time they forget about my order.
I have been coming here every week for over a year now. The service is amazing and the coffee/tea is delicious. It is always such a vibe.
Didn't get food but good drinks..pretty unique beer selection too

I absolutely loved this place when it opened. It was a fantastic blend of coffee shop and bottle shop where you wanted to spend all of your time. The owners spent an especially large effort making sure to stock bottles of wine and cans of beer you wouldn't see elsewhere. That hasn't changed so much but the vibe certainly has. This is pretty much a co-working spot now. Good luck finding a seat during the day. Even at around 5p on a Friday the bar is packed with laptops and people staring at screens. Glad it's busy, sad to see the vibe change so much.

Walking in, you know there's something for everyone. Wine, draft beer, N/A, $100 can of beer. Wide range.

Seating almost forces you to talk to other people which is nice. While also easy enough for a quaint night.

Perfectly priced. Some items don't have price tags and that's on purpose ;)

Such a fun and cool atmosphere! Parking was okay, but to be expected in that part of town. Lots of space and a fun bar to sip your drink of choice. Seating is comfortable!
I got the vanilla latte and it was delicious! A pleasant surprise was that their beans are from Hatchet (my favorite coffee shop in Boone, NC)!
Customer service was great as well!

Definitely enjoyed my first visit at The Hobbyist. I had to meet someone there and we were able to enjoy the atmosphere comfortably while conducting our meeting. The staff was amazing and it was a great place to just sit, talk and vibe. Recommend this establishment highly. I look forward to heading back.
Current favorite coffee spot!
Plenty of seating space, loved the subdivision and arrange of the different sections. Wish they'd have more food options but loved the coffee.
Great selection of coffee, wine, beer, and spirits! Comfortable tables and a surprising amount of space. The vanilla lavender latte was amazing!
There's always a lively crowd present, and I greatly appreciate the welcoming atmosphere the staff creates.

They do not have flavored syrup shots like raspberry and strawberry. Other than that I guess everything was fine? Not being able to get some of your favorite flavored coffees is kind of 99% of going there...right? Otherwise it was good.
Great spot to post up got coffee during the day or a drink at night and work, socialise, or catch live music in Friday nights. They have good coffee and a great wine and beer by the bottle selection

I stopped in here this morning and ordered a creme brulee latte with a raspberry cream cheese danish. Before we get into the coffee and danish, let me say that I was really digging the design and vibe of this place. They managed to accomplish a more classy and intimate setting, but at the same time it was also laid back and easy going. I found this to be a unique combination of atmospheres for a coffee shop. Although, they do have wine and a good whiskey selection so that may be why there is an overlap in the settings that I was experiencing. I also appreciated the no laptops on the weekends concept that they have implemented. Even though I didn't find myself chatting with any locals, which is what they stated the goal of this concept is, I think it's a great idea! I find that we too often bury ourselves into technology and forget to experience the things around us. It's a step in the right direction, and a good way to increase the interactions among others. Now, back to the coffee and danish. The creme brulee latte was spot on and the danish was exactly what I needed to get my morning started. I liked the location of this place, and I definitely see The Hobbyist being one of my go to coffee shops!
Ordered a hot latte. Right amount of foam and great tasting overall. Staff was super friendly. 5/5
Love this place but you gotta have 3 workers in the morning. It's always a huge wait here.

Espresso is fruity. Cold brew is strong (guess it is from a dark roast blend)  wait time is long (I know it takes time to make a good coffee, but if you prefer to get in and out quickly, just be aware).
Probably my favorite coffee shop

Been a few times while house sitting for a friend. It's always over a ten minute wait to get my latte, even when no drinks in line in front of me. Barista's seem to busy chatting or flirting with people, than to make the orders! Todays latte not only took 10 minutes, but the milk was burnt!

Overall nice spot. Visited from Chicago yesterday and my only complaint is that the barista didn't know what a cortado was. I ordered a cortado and got a short latte--way too much milk. Please educate the staff on how to make a proper cortado. It's not a short latte!
Best coffee in clt
It's good in the morning

Sorry, just had a cup of coffee but it was average at best.
Nice place, worth a second shot, but coffee is questionable.
My new favorite coffee shop in Charlotte! Great coffee with a twist  And the Old Fashioned was good too. Best of all, the vibe and the live music!

Cute little coffee shop that has lounge areas and an outside patio with a very relaxed atmosphere. Drinks were good, awesome place for meeting with friends, working, a date, or just to relax with coffee and a book!
Beautiful and delicious cappuccino.  Also had a croissant which was buttery and flaky.  Service impeccable.
Cutest little place with great coffee!
The coffee is good, nothing crazy but very solid. Interior is really nice, great place to work.

I want so badly to like this place. But I just can't. Walking distance from our house and we have come here a ton of times but literally every time we come there is a hilariously bad interaction. Whether it's the cashier telling us there was "no way to know" whether a pastry was vegetarian or not, being scolded for having our dog on a leash while we ordered only to see the same manager petting a dog in line the next time we were there or waiting 10 minutes for a cold pastry to be placed in a bag it's always some completely avoidable example of poor service. My breaking point to leave this review was being charged 45 cents for water (which I had to fill myself) after we paid $19 for two coffees and one pastry. I get it. Cups cost money. And our service was very friendly (and apologetic) this time. I've never left a Google review before but please make some changes, The Hobbyist.
BEST ESPRESSO MARTINI IN CHARLOTTE.

I absolutely love going to the hobbyist. It's my favorite coffee shop in Charlotte because the vibes are soooo good. Everyone is so kind and friendly, and it's a great place to make a barista friend  oh and they do some really cool events like tastings and mini night markets!

Their managers, Alice and Nate, are such kind people and I love seeing them there!

My favorite drink here so far has been the strawberry matcha, but I love their cappuccinos and lattes too. They also often have vegan pastries in their case!!

Outgoing baristas. The atmosphere has a great vibe. Excellent hours of operation. The assistant manager is extremely friendly. I will be back to visit with him and grab another delicious iced mocha in the near future.

I love stopping by in the morning for some amazing coffee, their lattes are always tasty and change seasonally!  Evenings are fun too, I love the live music, pop ups and the vibes. Staff are always super friendly and always make you feel welcome. Don't sleep on The Hobbyist.

What a hidden gem! This is one of my favorite spots in Charlotte to grab a coffee or drink - the coffee is exceptional, especially their unique seasonal lattes, their speciality cocktails are delicious, the staff is lovely and extremely attentive, the decor and overall vibe is chic yet welcoming. Quite honestly, this place is the absolute BEST - a lovely spot to hang where the staff and owners truly treat you like family.

This is one of the best places in Charlotte to grab a coffee or drink! Morning or night the staff is knowledgeable and so friendly! They also have a great selection of varying pastries if you need a snack! 10/10 would recommend.
The Hobbyist is my top recommendation of specialty coffee shops in Charlotte! Kind & attentive staff, jazz nights, and stunning seasonal drinks. I still think about the strawberry matcha latte.
Love this place! The energy is great every time I go there, and their seasonals are the best in Charlotte

Notice how frequently the staff changes at this shop. You don't see that at most spots in the neighborhood. Says a lot.

Response to your comment: Not "strange" to point out the extremely high turnover rate (which negatively impacts the quality of your product) and seeing an entirely new staff that every time I've come in. But sure, everyone else must be the problem. Keep doing what you're doing, it's clearly working.

This place is next door from a business I frequent and today I finally decided to stop in. I tried the Iced Marigold Mocha (I think that's what it was called). I loved it. This is a cute place and I will definitely be stopping in after my sessions and it looks like a cozy place that I can work from. Staff was friendly. The place was clean and beautiful.
Immaculate vibes
Excellent in every way, but I do wish they had plain or savory pastry options. Charlotte needs more spinach-feta scones!

Amazing little coffee, bar, dessert .....we absolutely loved it and recommend it to anyone looking for a cozy sneak away place to grab a drink or a bite. They even had live music...The Rusty Bucket was playing and they were jamming. Loved it. A+ Clean friendly and fun.

I came here with my sister to unwind while she works on her college work, and I had a very tasty lavender vanilla latte. I wholeheartedly recommend it! However, the service wasn't the best when we ordered it. Although our cashier wasn't as warm and helpful as I had hoped, the environment was definitely the most important factor, and it was a lovely place to motivate people to do their work. Definitely would visit this location for work or just to chill out.

This cafe is really aesthetically pleasing and the atmosphere was very relaxing. My sister and I came on a Thursday to study and got the lavender vanilla latte and it was amazing! The only reason for the 4/5 stars was that the bartender did not seem interested in us as customers and did not seem very lively. The bathrooms are clean and so was the furniture.
Stopped in just for a quick drink...absolutely beautiful espresso martini!!  Must try it!

I really enjoyed the Matcha latte. The Cappucino is also excellent.
The service was good and they accommodated all our needs for the drinks.

The cinnamon roll was very good albeit too sweet for our liking. it complements the coffee very well. If you have a sweet tooth, go for it.

Maybe for older  people 
Just coffee with hazelnut creamer..
Otherwise I will return every time I come back...
Nice coffee shop in NODA,

Really cool spot, great prices, good Wi-Fi lol. They carry an interesting selection of products outside of what they serve in house. Great place to scare off the Sunday/Monday scaries with their sunday mimosa deal. I love to stop in & catch up on some emails on a sunday. Really lovely staff as well.
This place treats paying clients like an inconvenience. Very disappointed!

The female barista with the long black/brown hair gives me dirty looks like she hates my guts for using my e-book reader at the bar.  I asked other baristas who told me I was totally fine, since it didn't have a keyboard.   I spent a lot of money here and left good tips, but I am not coming back again because I don't like spending money at a place I feel hated.  I personally don't like their "unplugged" policy, as well the fact that different staff enforce it differently.

Personally, I understand if the bar is crowded to not have someone sitting around not buying anything.  But, if you are there buying drinks and there is nobody around (like how it was when I was there) it makes no sense to tell people not to sit there.   As someone with herniated discs its not easy to find adequate high chair seating in the place either.   And , to be honest, I have never been to any bar or coffeeshop around town who forbids me from using my e-reader at the bar, which is ridiculous in itself.

I was really liking this place and most of the baristas are real nice, but it takes one bad apple to chase you out of the place.  Also, they need to rethink their policy of keeping people away from the bar area.

My husband and I really like going to the hobbyists especially because it's one of the few coffee shops open later in Charlotte. The vibes are really nice and we love the outdoor tables and chairs that are in view of uptown.
Great selection of beers and wine.
It took over an hour to get a cappuccino. After taking my order he went on break and then a rush of people came in and my order was lost

If you don't leave a tip, they give an attitude and bump you to the bottom. I waited ten minutes while they made the guy behind me his two lattes. Won't be back and won't recommend to anyone else. I prefer to tip after I have received what I purchased... and this is exactly why
Love it here! Grab a bottle, glass or can of beer and sit outside! My husband and I took our dog for a nice walk around the park and then sat outside for a glass of wine.
Best coffee in Charlotte!

I had the Thai basil strawberry matcha latte. I had oat milk instead of traditional milk. It was delicious! I had never tried matcha before and I really enjoyed their take on it. Great seating areas and good atmosphere. They have three types of non-dairy milks available, which is nice for those with allergies.
This is one of the few places that still serves coffee drinks in the evening! We managed to find parking down the street and there seems to be a small parking lot in the back.
Fantastic 3rd place for anyone, especially students and those working.

I had the best Carmel macchiato I've ever had in my life from there! Great atmosphere! I went to work on my book, and surprisingly enough, I was able to concentrate even though it was busy and pretty crowded. I loved how they had plenty of outlets at the bar for charging my tablet. If I lived in Charlotte, I'd go all the time.
Black walnut latte hot, just get it
Great place to hang out and get coffee.  Great selection of wine and craft beer.  Staff are friendly and quick.
It's a 5!
Waited over 30 minutes for coffee because they dropped the ticket during the handoff between cashier and barista.

Most underrated coffee shop in Charlotte. I might be bias because this place is in our neighborhood. Went there on a Friday night, there was live Jazz music and tons of drink options. If there is nothing on tap for you, you can choose from plenty of bottles and cans in their bottle shop. Everything was 10/10 and we are definitely back for their $3 mimosas on Sundays. Attaching their weekly specials so you can plan your date.

Randomly found this place on a random google search for places to chill in Charlotte before a concert. This spot was everything and more. We came at evening time and we're looking for an espresso martini and good coffee. Gosh we were blown away. Incredible service, perfectly curated music, friendly service and a dim/moody/cozy atmosphere. The Black Walnut Latte was everything I needed. We came back again the next afternoon and Ty was so kind!
This place is wonderful. It can benefit from additional seats or couches.

workers ignored us when we ordered, had to ask again where's my coffee as no one was bothered enough to ask or do anything but 4 workers chit chat instead of working. coffee wasn't even full in the cup. I'm going to starbucks instead

The coolest place ever. They have coffee options, but the beer and wine options are the reason I go there, in addition to the chill atmosphere. They hold jazz nights there once a month which i also highly recommend. Overall a great place to hang with friends, or wfh in the afternoon!

The vibes are unmatched at the Hobbyist.

Friendliest team in Charlotte and they know how to actually make a flat white(exceedingly rare in the US)

My fave spot
Ambiance is unmatched and quality of products is exceptional, not to mention superb service.

Really cute!!

Might need more seating soon but that means it's poppin!!

I love places that serve coffee and beer at the same time like this place.

I just went in to buy a few cans of beer. It's very clean and quiet even though there was a lot of people there on their laptops. It seems like it would be a great place for that.

The canned/bottled beer selection is pretty good and the prices are fair, $7 for a Burial.

I'll be back.
The capuccino it is real close to the original from Italy. Right temperature, right foam. Great taste. Totally recommended.

Love this coffee and wine bar!! They sell selective bottled wine and beers. A cafe to work/study while sipping your desired coffee or wine. As I entered this place it smells coffee which melts my heart.

WOW!! I ordered the Iced Black Walnut Latte with half of oatmilk & almond milk. It was very unique and delicious. This place is definitely a good place to work and study. Surrounding music isn't too loud and here has very calm vive. It reminds me of SF. The interior was nice as well. Everything was good. It took almost 40 minutes from my home. But I am glad that I moved forward to visit here :)
Lovely staff. Great coffee!

Place is awesome.  Great beer, wine, and now bourbon.  If you're looking for a pick me up the Coffee is always great too .  Sometimes will have some live music that takes it up a notch.  Highly recommended

Was recommended by a friend to check this place out and I am glad I did.  I love everything about this place. They have great coffee and a chill spot to hang out or get some work done. An amazing selection of beer and wine. The staff was friendly, knowledgeable, and efficient in filling my order.  I noticed they have a nice selection of bourbon on the shelf and will have to come back on another day for that. If you love coffee, beer or wine this place is a must stop and I can't wait to go back.
Cute coffee shop wine hang out. Live music fri night. Smaller than pictures.
Luuuuuurve it. This place is amazing and wonderful and we have the best time. Such a good vibe and lovely people.
Very friendly staff, great selection of wine, and cute place! Overall 5/5 stars.

What an awesome bottle shop with great coffee, amazing selection of wine, craft beer and a nice surprise to see some bourbon as well. The staff was attentive and friendly, the manager Alice was very nice and I even met the owner who was extremely kind and helpful. I will definitely be bringing my friends back here, a nice regular hangout spot.
Amazing service!  All the staff was very friendly, especially Alice. Huge selection of craft beer. Grab a cup of coffee while there, you don't want to miss that!
Great selections and great establishment
When I go there I order things. They serve them. They are good. People are good. I order things.
I was basically asked to leave because I didn't order anything. Don't go there.
The atmosphere was awesome! The coffee a little burned, and the cinnamon roll delicious!
Friendly staff, great ambience & impressive coffees. It's a good vibe.

lovely cafe, bar, & bottle shop. beautiful modern industrial space with plenty of seating (comparatively in CLT) that walks the line of a clean cut modern & vintage vibe without feeling too cold or crowded. lots of plants throughout the space and soft seating as well as tables and a full bar. great selection of craft beers and wine. the coffee is excellent - they use hatchet beans and their menu is pared down with excellent, unique seasonal offerings. you can always get a good latte, any time of day, but some of their team is definitely more beer & wine experienced or coffee experienced - if you get one of the baristas who are really into coffee, your drink will be incredible. their black walnut latte is one of my favorite lattes i've ever had. incredible iced or hot.

overall 5/5 for attentive staff & service, space, and selection. if you haven't been yet, add the hobbyist to your next outing!
Best coffee in Charlotte area. The variety of wine bottles is amazing, so many decent options.
Best lavender latte in the city!
Love this place, amazing coffee and great vibe! The perfect coffee shop to sit down and do some work or just hang out.
Perfect customer service! Cappuccino was on point! The location is so cute and cozy!
No cronuts like they advertise
Excellent specialty coffee. Great for working remote.

Yesterday, I went to The Hobbyist through recommendation of my coworkers. I've heard many great things about this place, and to my surprise, The Hobbyist exceeded my expectations. My friends and I all got the Chai and it was very delicious, probably the best Chai I've ever had. And my friends agreed, it was also the best Chai they've had and we are obsessed! It had a fresh spiced flavor and was pretty sweet - as though they melted a gingerbread cookie into a beverage. Not only that, the vibes are cozy, classy, and very chic. The barista who served our drinks also had a lovely personality: they were friendly and very funny! Now whenever someone asks where I can find the best Chai, I will immediately say The Hobbyist!!!

I used to like this place. Coffee was so so not amazing for the price of a simple iced coffee. I typically go after the dentist but today the shop felt dreary and a bit empty than usual. As for the quality of my coffee it felt over bitter and tasted a bit old. Would I recommend this place? I guess it depends, hopefully next time the coffee quality and atmosphere will improve.
Traveling from Colorado, this place is awesome for coffee or bakery goods. A very reasonable price. My friends had beer and loved it. You have to visit here.
Great atmosphere and delicious food and drinks. Will definitely be back.
It's dope

Great local spot, excellent coffee and locally sourced pastries, and an extensive wine and beer selection

Very welcoming staff, and pleasant laid back atmosphere, my new go-to hangout in Charlotte!

Tried their mocha latte, it was pretty good what made the experience even better was the service and how helpful the barista was (wish I got her name she was truly amazing) and the sitting areas. There is parking in the back with plenty of space as well as street parking on the left side of the plaza.
People of color are not welcomed here. I wish I had the strength to go into detail about my experience but I don't.
Great atmosphere and amazing Coffee.
They make a great Cortado here and often have Friends on tv.  Can't go wrong with that!
Love this place! The selection is awesome and I love the ambience!

This place was absolutely amazing. We were traveling and stopping through but are big coffee shop people. We loved everything from the ambience, the view, and the staff. What a great experience as we were in Charlotte for only a couple days. Will be coming back if we're in town again

Was recommended this as a place for good beer while I do some work on my computer. Got there to signs saying no laptops, so that's a no go, I guess? Judging from some other reviews I just read, this seems to be a common complaint. Bad policy imo.
The Baristas are passionate about coffee. We really enjoyed our visit here.

stopped by the other evening to have a drink and a snack while getting some writing done. all the baristas were incredibly helpful, kind, and attentive, the pastries were to-die-for, and both the iced tea and the hot chocolate I ordered were spectacular! definitely will be coming back here more often!

No WiFi Friday-Sunday, their policy. No indication of this policy, yet the WiFi guest password is displayed. Place is great, I just like policies that affect the guest experience upfront and with consistency. Make the password flyer double-sided. So when Friday-Sunday comes around you can flip it over to say "weekend event-no internet. Enjoy."

Coffee good
Vibes good
Seasonal drinks good

I visited this location a month or so ago for the first time, it started off fairly bleh... There was a barista who was pretty short tempered with me. I didn't know where to check out, and she got angry about it and rushed me when I inserted my card. She didn't ask me if I needed assistance nor did she give me the to-go cup I requested when I purchased a chai tea.
Anyways, things got progressively better when the young African American woman entered. She was more polite and asked if I needed anything, and was pleasant to be around as I sat and worked on my laptop. Soon the first girl left and it was even better when the three gentlemen entered. Had the best tasting Caramel Macchiato, and the customer service was much better from them. The experience got better and plus the shop doubles as a brewery too! So that was pretty cool! It's a good place to go within the area when out on a date or visiting the NoDa area.

Been here twice, both TO-GO visits. I was greeted warmly each time. I consider myself a coffee guy so I notice certain aspects:
- They serve drinks at the right proportions, not huge 16oz lattes and 14oz cappuccinos.
- Always a fan of coffee shops that make their own syrups. Drinks aren't overly sweet a.la Starbucks. (the entire purpose of going to a small coffee shop imo).
- Even when To-Go, barista still took the time to put an appropriate design in my latte. Don't know his name but the taller white guy.
9.3/10 (still need to sit in).

I don't care to leave reviews but I'm going to start because wow this place was overhyped! Below average lattes. I've never actually been to a coffee shop that can't make a good caramel latte because of this place, now I have! They only have Black Walnut, Lavender Vanilla, Vanilla, and Caramel flavors despite what google reviews showed and don't sell cronuts anymore which we were most excited for. The limited menu wouldn't bother me if the menu they did have was good. I'd recommend Undercurrent Coffee or Not Just Coffee instead.

Amazing atmosphere, and great spot for working and short conversations.
I tried the half sweet honey bee flat white and it was just balanced!
Alice is great!

Great coffee. Awesome vibe. Should definetly checking out if you are in the area. Try the black walnut latte. Grab a few craft beers while your at it!! Owner was super cool too. Sat and chatted for a while.
Chill vibe with good Coffee!

This is a forewarning for anyone looking to study or work on the weekends. This is also not a review of the staff, the beverages, or the ambiance, but I felt like this was an important message. I went to prepare for the work week on Sunday afternoon and found the tables riddled with small "No Laptop" signs on the tables. At the time, my initial thinking was that the establishment did not want computers on the furniture (because the alternative, banning them completely, seemed absured given that I regularly worked at The Hobbyist this summer. Shortly after getting my tea did one of the employees let me know about their new "unplug policy" on the weekends to give patrons a chance to connect with one another in person (although, when I looked around, the policy didn't seem to be efficacious). On the weekends, I sometimes need to get out of the house and complete work in a neutral space with other people who are similar in that regard, but I feel that this recent policy overplays its hand and falls short of the intended goals. Restricting patron's autonomy and choice in the entire space detracts from the neutrality of what I feel a coffee shop represents.

Had a latte and flat white. Large and spread out space with lots of seating, love the decor/vibe.  Coffee was pretty good but 2 criticisms would be milk was a tad overheated and espresso a little harsh. It did mellow out eventually and finish nicely.  Overall nice shop but for me plaza midwood undercurrent is still reigning champ.

I walked in after my visit to the dentist and decided to get a draft from the bar. There were 1-2 people in line to get coffee drinks. Which the three staff members were seemingly busy with tending to their drinks. There were also two other customers at the bar who had been served already. None of the staff seemed to care that I had entered the establishment and sat at the bar, didn't  even look my way. I entered the place through the front door. They were moving slowly as if they had time to kill. At one point the woman employee sat back for a quick break and didn't even bother to look over to see if needed anything. At this point I had been waiting there about ten minutes. I like this place and expect a higher level of customer service. I reluctantly decided to leave.
The place is amazing  the coffee was soooo good , the Banana bread was delicious
You'll always find a friendly staff. A great place to grab a coffee/ beer and work or just hang out.

They stay so busy! I went on a Friday afternoon and the place was packed. That's definitely an amazing thing. They had a great selection of coffee options and wine/beer. I enjoyed their seasonal Black Walnut Latte and it was really tasty.

This is my favorite coffee/wine shop in Charlotte. The vibes are giving with the greenery and the antiques!

The coffee is quality and they are very serious about their craft. The wine and beer offerings are also always spot on and the staff take the time to help me find the perfect picks! The General Manager also stepped aside to show me around the wine and I was very thankful!

Overall 10/10
Live music on Fridays is awesome.
amazing selection of teas!! and the interior is so beautiful

Amazing atmosphere, clean and nice bathrooms, great public wifi. Love their caffeinated and wine/beer menus alike. I always go by for their sour fridge area to try new local brews. I like how there is 4 areas for seating/working. Near the back entrance, bar seating with TVs, near the front entrance, and outside on the patio. Lastly it's great location for anyone coming off the Greenway / parkway just south

The Hobbyist has what many cafes lack these days. They have an understanding of their espresso pulls and the art of making a drink to give you a beautifully presented beverage with the right flavor as well. I had a few of their selection. The chai latte is exactly what a chai latte should be. It didn't taste overly sweet like many do and the different spices and herbs of the chai were present and clear. Their espresso was also wonderful. I'm not usually someone who enjoys just straight espresso but I suppose I do when it is done right. The Hobbyist does it right. The live band in the background also helped add to the experience. Very pleased.

Great coffee, cool place and the staff is always super nice and helpful with great suggestions! My favorite coffee place in Charlotte. The black walnut iced latte with oat milk is AMAZING and is my go to there.
Great place to sit in the afternoon for a drink and to get some evening work in.  Some of the best beer prices in the area, quality wine selection.
Great Coffee and good vibes... even the other customers are friendly which says a lot about the establishment
The staff is great but decaf coffee seems to be an afterthought here. Due to health reasons I have to cut my caffeine intake and the shop doesn't seem to keep a consistent stock.
I went here yesterday with my buddy Josh.  I loved their Black Walnut Latte.  I drank 2 of them.  I had a hot and an ice.  It was perfectly made!

I want to like this place but I've had hilariously bad service all three times I've gone here. I asked if the savory croissant had any meat in it and was told "there's no way for them to know because they didn't make it in the house". Friend asked for her scone while we waited for our coffee "it's just really busy we will give it to you with the coffee." It was not really busy and there were 3 people working behind the counter. Every interaction that I've had with people that work here they've been strangely rude.

The Hobbyist is so cute, the coffee is great, and they have a really nice selection of beer/wine/sake/CBD products. I love going there Friday nights for live music, and the people working there are incredibly friendly. This was one of the first places I tried when I moved to Charlotte and I've gone back several times!
I got an Americano with Vanilla, it was a very nice and strong coffee.

Decent coffee, and great staff. Its open late so that's the main reason I go here. The only issues are every Friday night they have bands come it, which are extremely loud and sometimes not very good. Its hard to use this coffee shop like a coffee shop when you cant talk to the person next to you or study. Additionally, they have a big garage door in the front, which they keep open way too much, when its very hot and very cold. The owners don't give the workers the authority to close it, even when the weather is terrible.

Reply: Thank you for your reply... wasn't looking for PR response though... Just letting the general public know what the shop is like. The back area consists of a couch and 3 chairs, when there's a band or the doors are open, those get filled VERY quickly. I've asked about the windows, and been told that the owner watches the employees over the video camera's, and makes them keep the doors open even when they and/or customers want them closed.
Great experience. Very busy though, we were there during their morning rush. They handled it well though!! Fun staff, very in the know, and lots of delicious things to try. I'll definitely go back!!
This place continues to be my favorite coffee shop I have tried here in Charlotte so far.
My favourite place to get coffee in all of Charlotte.  Great staff, great coffee, great atmosphere
Fun place to meet friends or just sit quietly reading a book or reflecting on life in Charlotte!

I went to the Hobbyist this morning and was blown away by the skill and hospitality of the Barista's.

The overall service was amazing! It was truly a grand example of what third wave coffee should be! I ordered one of their signature lattes (Toasted Sage & Fig) it was spot on. The flavors blended perfectly with the espresso!

They have pastries delivered from a local bakery down the street too (which I think is amazing since they don't have a kitchen in house)

The atmosphere is stunning. You can tell that whoever designed the space carefully curated the antiques and plants with intention! They have plenty of seating but from what I could see it was filling up fast.

This is now my new favorite specialty coffee spot in Charlotte! Way to go Hobbyist!!!!!

Other than being told that I will be charged for water in a to-go cup despite being a paid customer, this is a cool spot to get some work done. Seating is comfortable with power outlets widely available! The drinks are good and they have a decent wine selection.
Good vibes, tons of space and a coffee bar to sit at. Very comfy place.. The cinnamon bun was good but need a tad bit more frosting. Loved it all..

Great coffee! The cronut we had was to die for. The chill vibes of this place make me wish I had a reason to stay and hang out with my laptop to study/work. Alas I'm not that cool... so I just sit with my coffee and pretend to look productive.
Great coffee and super yummy cronut

The most stunning decor with a truly wonderful staff. In the day and age of COVID/severe staffing issues, the Hobbyist runs a seamless operation that offers outstanding service and exceptional products. Cheers to their dedication to quality and commitment to top tier service in unprecedented times.
Ordered 2 iced coffee, waited 27 mins. Very very understaff or may be they are just slow? Not not worth the experience.

Recently found this gem in NoDa. I was inquiring for a bottle of wine I had been searching for locally. Unable to find it on the shelf, I ask one of the employees behind the coffee bar. She tried to find it with me on the shelf, but no luck. She went in to the back of the store, only to come back with the bottle I had been searching for. SCORE !!!!  Very pleased with the helpful staff and cool atmosphere. Will be frequenting here again soon.
Such a pleasant place to be. Drinks are so enjoyable and the physical space is great. Grab a bottle of wine or a six pack of brews on your way out.
Yummy iced matcha latte, fantastic cronuts, friendly staff, unique enviornment.

Great Latte flavors and presentation, hope they open a good breakfast menu too.
Soothing place to hangout with friends.

Love the idea of a coffee bar that also doubles as a chill spot with draft beers! The Hobbyist also had cooled beer that can buy to drink there or make four packs to go. Did I mention wine that they can uncork for you? It has couches and tables, as well as an actual bar. You can stay as little as long as you'd like. The coffee was delicious, and I loved all the drinking options! Will def be returning.

Nice place but takes forever to get a latte made. I would have ordered drip coffee if I thought I'd have to wait 15 minutes for a latte. The food was good and the ambiance was nice  but not worth the wait if you're in a rush.
Cute bottle shop and friendly staff. They customized an order for me, which was great!
Good vibe and coffee. Excellent bottle selection

You gotta know the good cafe from the first step by the great smell of coffee.
And that's what you can experience at the Hobbyist.
The coffee is absolutely good! real taste of espresso if you're looking for. However it was a bit time taking precess for two cups of cappuccino in not a very busy day.
The location is kinda in a remote area.

Fabulous espresso, beer and wine place. Their espresso, latte, and cortado are among the best in Charlotte for sure. Their beer and wine selection is also very broad. The staff are very nice, and the place has an elegant but relaxed atmosphere that is very cool. Highly recommended

Nice spot to meet up with a friend for coffee. I was there on a Saturday morning. A lot of seating available. I also bought some beer and wine to go. I had the cold brew and it was good. Overall a cute spot!
Nice place for a coffee and conversation. They have options for bottled wine and beer. Along with draft beer. Would recommend this for a quick stop at NoDa.
Amazing atmosphere, awesome spot to work, have a date, read, or hang with friends. Incredible beer, wine and coffee selection.

Cool little hipster joing on N. Davidson St in NoDa.  When you walk in, your senses are celebrated with beautifully roasted coffee.  A bar to the right, a fridge full of beer to the left.  Wine and more beer up ahead.  Tables and chairs.  People on laptops drinking coffee and/or beer.

Very nice taplist.  This go around I ordered an IPA and the fill was PERFECT.  Up to the rim.  My beertender slowly walked my order to the bar, making sure not to spill a drop.  Well done, Beertender.

While enjoying my tasty beverage, I perused the beer fridges.  I found a rare bottle you don't normally find in this area and set it on the bar to take home.

Staff was attentive and friendly.  We cracked some jokes, had some laughs and I was off.  Thanks Hobbyist!
First time visiting The Hobbyist, what an awesome space, great coffee and chilled atmosphere and the sound system and music dang, I stayed and had another drink. Keep it up, perfect.
hot choc da bamb
Best Coffee Joint in Charlotte AND!!!!! Outstanding Bartender and Barista Service!!! Boo Yah Ka Shah!!!!
Great selection of beer but the girl behind the bar knew nothing about the beer. Weird.
Great atmosphere and beer selection. Very friendly staff. Will definitely visit again.
Such a cute coffee spot! The staff are always friendly & welcoming. The vibe of this place just feels good. Love the coffee & pastries, especially the kronuts. Yum!
Just discovered this gem! Definitely will come back soon
Prefect place with your friends or to work
The interior designer did an awesome job with this place. This is a great place for a casual meeting or just to enjoy an expresso and chill.

What a cool place! Stopped by before brunch for some coffee. We ordered a drip coffee and the honey bee flat white (hot, oat milk). The music inside was very loud, lots of punk rock tunes. It made for an interesting vibe, but I have no complaints. I want to go back to try their pastries or their bottles of beers/wines. They got pretty busy but the staff was friendly! Lots of seating options available, parking spots in the back too. It's so cool that they have plants and other little merchandise items for sale. Definitely want to return next time I'm in Charlotte.
Elite taplist and can selection

I was very pleasantly surprised :) Aside from a nice atmosphere, lots of seating and great staff, there's also a wide selection of wines, including Japanese sake brands. I enjoyed my afternoon here for sure.

(Be aware that they are currently requesting masks for entry. But that's neither here nor there)
Great coffee, definitely has some interesting choices in their alcohol section.
The waitress is very professional and friendly, she opened a new bag of coffee for me just to ensure the freshness of the coffee!
Always a nice atmosphere and good selection of different types of beers and wines. Great coffee and kombucha as well. A spot i like to go and hang out and relax. Board games there as well
Great service.
My Black Walnut latte was great
Love the atmosphere, coffee, and the staff. Anytime I go to grab some coffee I always feel welcomed!
Was visiting Charlotte and hit this place almost every day.  Cool place to get a good cup of coffee or a pint of beer.

We spent a long weekend in Charlotte and visited the Hobbyist every day we were there. Really good coffee, fun beer and wine selection, local snacks, live music, beautiful space - we wish we had a Hobbyist near our house! Really enjoyed all the time we spent there
Nice atmosphere, great service.... I only had tea here.
Really chill place, love the vibe and atmosphere. Will go there again. I ordered the peppermint tea and it was great. Service was great too
Wonderful Americana coffee and the kronuts are to die for.

I love this place. The environment, the staff, the coffee, everything is just great. It's become my go-to place to work at. The baristas are super friendly and its just a a great place. I could not speak any better about this establishment. If you're in Charlotte or live here, this is the place to be.
Nice chill spot to grab a coffee, tea or beer. Employees were very nice and respectful. Will return soon.
Great Cozy Ambiance. Clean facilities and friendly staff!
Very relaxing and a nice place to  conversate with good friends
The place has a great vibe. The coffee as very good. Nice place to hang out with friends or get some work done.
A new favorite! From the chill yet playful playlist, great customer service, cute decor, and yummy drinks. Quite aesthetically pleasing; a vibe to visit for sure.
Awesome little neighborhood shop! Has a little bit of everything.

I love the coffee at this place and have been coming for over a year! I typically use the Odeko app to order and it's proven to be very unreliable. Today I ordered a coffee through Odeko that was quoted to be ready in 10 minutes and it wasn't ready after 30 minutes. I had to leave without the coffee due to an appointment. I sent an email to Management regarding a refund.

Update: owner reached out and ensured a refund was issued and apologized. Thank you!

Something I always look for in a coffee shop is good atmosphere, and this place has it. Super cool place inside with some awesome seating. Only downside is the seating is very limited. There are tables outside but if you going during a busy time it can be crowded. Coffee & tea are both great and the display is wonderful to. Shop also has a decent selection of wine bottles and beer for sale to take home.
Awesome experience great beverage menu hot or cold ....non alcohol/ alcohol

One of the more "Hip"  coffee places I've had the pleasure of visiting. Everything in this place screams we take our coffee and drinks very seriously. I literally watched them weigh each part of my iced latte, from the cup with ice to milk to the shot of espresso; quite impressive. And with all that effort, my coffee was top notch, just the right balance of coffee bitterness and creamy whole milk.

They also have a huge selection of wine and beer, and good sampling of options on tap. This place is definitely an upscale, get relaxing spot to have a coffee or a drink, whether you're trying to get some work done or just meeting a friend. I'll definitely be back!

Spectacular coffee - we were in Charlotte for a quick two day trip and the coffee was so good that we went back on day two to try out more of their menu! Very nice service, and we were able to relax on one of their couches with our toddler for a while while we enjoyed our coffee. Highly recommend!

I really want to love this place. The environment is great, the coffee is great.

I order through the app almost every weekend, but literally every weekend it takes over an hour to get the coffee and it's cold or warm. The last two weekends this has happened where my coffees have just been behind the counter when my name wasn't called or anything. After an hour I'd get them. I hope we can be friends

Again love the place and the coffee when it's hot, but for some reason I can't get it to work right.
Coffee was bitter, but people and scenery were great
They have great prices and the beer  Selections are amazing
Great espresso beverages, staff was super-friendly, and a great space to hang/work in. Highly recommend this place!

Some of the best curated taps in town, always tons of something new and interesting, great can cider and wine selection, friendly staff, sorry for staying till last call but you have a great evening vibe.

Absolutely love the environment and variety of coffee selections. The only thing I wish they would have is more edible options with bread/croissants included. I love that they have plants, wine, and lots of other cool things you can purchase to take home! I would come here just to buy wine if I'm looking for a good wine shop.
Overpriced and bakery items are old
If you like coffee and alcohol this is thr place to go. There's no shame in getting a coffee in the morning and your drinks for later. Plus with the wide variety of options, you can't just go once!
First time here, wonderful vibe, will be back.
Chill atmosphere,  good beer selection and kind, knowledgeable staff.

Very nice chill place. Outdoor seating and also indoor with tables and chairs or if you're feeling the lounge vibe they have couches. Super friendly staff. I tried their walnut latte with oat milk and it was amazing!!!! Also had one of their sakes and that was delicious as well. Totally coming back.
Love love The Hobbyist to grab great beer!!! The owners Bryson and Julie know what's going on in the beer and wine market these days! They have their finger on the pulse, if you wish to say.
Amazing space and great choices of beverage.  Staff was wonderful.  We had a great experience.  Highly recommend to all!
Excellent
I hope this place to be located in front of my place to go everyday
Perfect coffee shop !
Love their coffee! Wish there were more food options but their latte is incredible.
Really great coffee and aesthetic with parking in the back. Highly recommend
Both of the drinks that we ordered tasted good, but were not hot.  Will definitely try them again and adjust it was a one-off thing.
Pretty cool place, baristas are friendly and they make a great coffee, also there is some food options.
Excellent coffee, wonderful atmosphere.
Wonderful team of professionals. They were fun and full of energy. They even let me sing as I walked to the door. They all seem to be a true blessing.
